title: Davidvictorson
author: Davidvictorson
content: As a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc. They feature young millionaire traders in beautiful places or traders who make thousands of dollars and to be honest, it creates a feeling of inadequacy or distress in me because I am yet to reached those levels of success yet. However, I have begun to avoid them and what I do is to focus on my own trading goals and aspirations. As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content?

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: I can never felt intimidated, although that is me from when I have known about intimidation. I do not feel intimidated, life is not the same for everyone and someday may become mine. I try to focus on my trading and anything stupid thinking like intimidation may result into a failed trading. I use to say this: if you are a trader, you have to do away with everything that can make your mindset to be of low or poor quality. Focus on yourself and how you can achieve your long term goal in life. Among all, I am happy, there is nothing better than joy and happiness. The little I gained from trading is enough for me.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc.You can watch them but I don't.Life has many meaningful things to do and to enjoy not like watching videos from those guys. They are rich, let them be but most important things they make those videos is to gain more followers.Not strange to see influencers use their impacts to shill projects that later are scam projects and many people lose money. I watch Youtube videos about cryptocurrency and Bitcoin but only from channels that give me knowledge and educational videos.

comments.author: hyudien
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PM As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content?To be honest, I have felt that, but it's back to ourselves regarding the capabilities we have and the capital that is indeed not very sufficient. As a result, for me personally, the fate of a person in the world of trading cannot be equated with what we have achieved. Traders with big profits at a young age are in a process of ideal achievement, but should we continue to feel intimidated and feel we are unlucky? Finally, I prefer to build inspiration and make ideal achievements with self-satisfaction versions in the field of trading.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc. They feature young millionaire traders in beautiful places or traders who make thousands of dollars and to be honest, it creates a feeling of inadequacy or distress in me because I am yet to reached those levels of success yet. However, I have begun to avoid them and what I do is to focus on my own trading goals and aspirations. As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content?Not really and I'm even interested to know what they do aside from trading. I know that there go the self-made traders just to show off on social media. But for the best traders, you'll see their authenticity in many ways that you can.I'm not jealous nor intimidated by them but instead, I first ask a question in my mind if they're legit and if they are then I just think of it how can I achieve the same achievement that they've taken? It may not be exactly the same as them but like 1% or just the path that they've taken through the process.

comments.author: Jody.Drummer
comments.body: That should be used as motivation, if other people can, then we should also be able to get that success. However, if we feel intimidated by such things, it can be said that we have little or no confidence in ourselves. The question is, how is it possible to achieve success if you do not believe in the potential that exists within yourself? Even if we don't have the ability, then we can learn it. Everything needs a process and nothing happens instantly in this life.But such viewing must also be comprehensive in my opinion, because many beginners who see successful trader content find this trading easy. Because most of them only show when they are successful, without showing the process they are going through. It's not all like that, but it would be better for content creators like them to educate thoroughly including the risks that will be faced.

comments.author: teosanru
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc. They feature young millionaire traders in beautiful places or traders who make thousands of dollars and to be honest, it creates a feeling of inadequacy or distress in me because I am yet to reached those levels of success yet. However, I have begun to avoid them and what I do is to focus on my own trading goals and aspirations. As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content?I think most of these videos are absolutely fake. There is no point in distressing yourself for these videos because they aren't actually doing any trading they are just boasting upon their generational wealth, or maybe a few lucky trades and acting as if they are trading.  Real trading is hard and actually takes some times before you see good results and much more time before you can be a millionaire. Most of these people have more incomes from selling courses of trading than trading itself. So no need to get dishearten in these things.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I only watch a few of their videos because most of them only talk about their success and only show their profitable trades they will never show you their losses and when you try to copy them or try out the strategy that they do teach you'll only end up realizing losses. But the ones I do watch teach you how to overcome losses and move on and how to improve your strategy. Truly they do motivate us to learn more and also seek and grab any opportunities presented to us.

comments.author: Kasabus
comments.body: Quote from: tbct_mt2 on March 17, 2023, 02:14:42 PMQuote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc.You can watch them but I don't.Life has many meaningful things to do and to enjoy not like watching videos from those guys. They are rich, let them be but most important things they make those videos is to gain more followers.Not strange to see influencers use their impacts to shill projects that later are scam projects and many people lose money. I watch Youtube videos about cryptocurrency and Bitcoin but only from channels that give me knowledge and educational videos. Same with mine. If you feel intimidated and distressed, then simply stop watching them. After all, we know what’s real trading scenario is, if you think those videos are exaggerating, then let it be as they are only after with their followers because that’s where they can make and gain an income. YouTube videos could sometimes be true or not, it depends on how an individual sees it. But since they’re crypto influencers and would want to gain a lot of followers, they will do everything to attract a lot of viewers even if it’s crossing the line already.

comments.author: alastantiger
comments.body: The last and the worst thing i will ever do to myself is to feel inadequate or intimidated by anyone. Though it will be very hard to overcome that feeling, truth be told, the feelings will find its way to your heart but you shouldn't allow it go get to you. I have never felt intimidated on how successful another trader is. Everyone is successful according to your investment not only your investment but how you strategize and how determined you are about your business and also how you manage your business.I have no reason to feel inadequate or intimidated, i stay focused on my business and i don't let nothing get inbetween.

comments.author: Vaculin
comments.body: Quote from: hyudien on March 17, 2023, 02:21:37 PMQuote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PM As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content?To be honest, I have felt that, but it's back to ourselves regarding the capabilities we have and the capital that is indeed not very sufficient. As a result, for me personally, the fate of a person in the world of trading cannot be equated with what we have achieved. Traders with big profits at a young age are in a process of ideal achievement, but should we continue to feel intimidated and feel we are unlucky? Finally, I prefer to build inspiration and make ideal achievements with self-satisfaction versions in the field of trading. I guess it’s human nature to feel a bit of envy if we see young traders earning a lot already and making their dreams in life come to reality. But if you based yourself from the achievement of others, you will never grow and you might only continue to feel the pressure which is not helpful at all if you want to be a good trader and become highly profitable and skilled in it. Besides, traders have their own time when to make it big in trading, depending on how does a trader work hard and become the best version of himself. So I prefer to work on my own and follow my own strategies which for me are working well and are still reliable when trading.

comments.author: royalfestus
comments.body: Despite the fact that I don't want to sound racist, the extravagant display or spending of wealth is a peculiar feature of some races. You rarely see Germans, Chinese, and Jews showing off their wealth, this is more common among the young men though. Bitcoin made some people rich overnight, while others mishandled it until they lost everything owing to their lavish lifestyles. Make sure you don't learn the wrong things from those guys; learn how to build wealth, plan your finances for the long term, and keep your standard of living low.

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Neither intimidated nor inspired is what I’m feeling because I don’t compared my life achievement with others. Comparing to them or inspiring them will make my future limited on what others did and not on what I really want. We have different path and unique life achievements. It’s just a waste of time watching streams that boasting wealth because we don’t get anything from while they are getting money from our views.

comments.author: Finestream
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc. They feature young millionaire traders in beautiful places or traders who make thousands of dollars and to be honest, it creates a feeling of inadequacy or distress in me because I am yet to reached those levels of success yet. However, I have begun to avoid them and what I do is to focus on my own trading goals and aspirations. As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content? Honestly, it gives me more inspiration to thrive more because if they can be successful with trading, then the more I am more capable to. Regardless if those stories are fabricated or not, I do not mind as long as I will keep working on my own goal so I can be successful later on. After all, our success will only determine as to how tough and dedicated we are as traders by not letting some pressures affect our positive mindset.

comments.author: Distinctin
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc. They feature young millionaire traders in beautiful places or traders who make thousands of dollars and to be honest, it creates a feeling of inadequacy or distress in me because I am yet to reached those levels of success yet. However, I have begun to avoid them and what I do is to focus on my own trading goals and aspirations. As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content? It gives me more motivation and encouragement knowing that I can be something like that in the future. But when you experience what real trading is all about, you will realize that trading is never easy, it has its own highs and lows, and if your are weak and dull, you will never succeed in trading. So I’ve come to realized that youtube videos are not all true, some are just done because they are forced to do so since they are making a good income from it.

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc. They feature young millionaire traders in beautiful places or traders who make thousands of dollars and to be honest, it creates a feeling of inadequacy or distress in me because I am yet to reached those levels of success yet. However, I have begun to avoid them and what I do is to focus on my own trading goals and aspirations. As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content? I have not been intimidated seeing stories like this because for sure, these are done for a set goal. And to think that some are making it exaggerated, so I don’t have to be distressed or become annoyed in it. Because as much as I know trading, it’s never easy to earn profits, you should need the skills and knowledge first so you can expect profits in trading. And you have to be patient as well, as those who never have much patience in trading have end up quitting and lose their funds.

comments.author: Quidat
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc. They feature young millionaire traders in beautiful places or traders who make thousands of dollars and to be honest, it creates a feeling of inadequacy or distress in me because I am yet to reached those levels of success yet. However, I have begun to avoid them and what I do is to focus on my own trading goals and aspirations. As a small bitcoin trader, have you ever felt intimidated, distressed, inadequate or inspired after watching these types of videos or content?Its just jealousy and being that envy on what they had become and this is why we do feel about being intimidated or distressed rather than on having that inspired kind of perception.Just accept that there are people who are cherishing out their lifes or on what they had reached because they did really took the risks on engaging with trading whether those are not real or a real one thenwe dont really have something to do.Make these things to be an inspiration to make yourself more better but of course dont rush things up because things doesnt really work on this way.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Most of them are cons, scammers, shills looking for views from YouTube and probably get paid to shill more shitcoins to newbies... There is no way I can feel inspired by such kinds of people. The good thing is that it's so easy to identify such con artists just by looking at the way they present their videosMost will want you to join using their referral links or join a certain trade coaching class for a fee. If someone is rich as they claim, then why are they looking to earn a few dollars using referral links?

comments.author: lalabotax
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 17, 2023, 01:53:56 PMAs a small bitcoin trader, I feel intimidated rather than inspired when watch certain YouTube or Social Media titles or content like "Day in the Life of a Young Millionaire Trader in Dubai" or "Day In The Life of a 23 Year Old Making $10,000 a Day", or "A Day In The Life of a Crypto Trader" etc. If we focus on their result and achievement, yes, it is realistic if we sometimes feel uncomfortable with it. Because we commonly only can enjoy a small number of profits. But this is a trading world, where people with higher amounts of capital will also commonly will earn much higher profits. Moreover, if they have the professional skill and understanding, big amount, and also completed advanced tools and equipment. This will lead them to have a bigger chance to earn profits. But, should we be intimidated? Be calm and patient mate. Everyone has their era to be great in trading. You can take this as one of the reasons why you must be more serious in trading, to be smarter and better at trading. So, who knows that we someday can be one of them? haha

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: I choose not to watch those traders' content that shows their big profits since even if they did those big trading profits with pure trading skills, nothing gonna change the fact that they are just likely for a purpose of gaining viewers and adding subscribers. I am more likely to watch traders' content related to educational purposes since even if there's a purpose of gaining viewers, it's good to watch content that can feed our minds and not just watch how much money these traders are making for trading.We have different views though regarding that matter but I will stand to my own.
